name: visualsgifs
description: Shows local GIFs as editor decorations based on events.

visualsgifs.gifFolderPath.description: Absolute path to your main GIF folder. (e.g., C:\Users\YourName\Documents\MyGifs)

visualsgifs.activeSeries.description: List of series (sub-folders) to activate. (e.g., ["k-on", "vocaloid"]) GIFs in the root folder are always active.

visualsgifs.display.maxWidth.description: The maximum width (in pixels) of the GIF.

visualsgifs.display.maxHeight.description: The maximum height (in pixels) of the GIF.

visualsgifs.display.durationSeconds.description: How long the GIF stays on screen (in seconds). Set to 0 to keep it until the next event.

visualsgifs.afk.timeInMinutes.description: Time in minutes of inactivity to be considered AFK.

visualsgifs.tags.error.description: Tags to search for when an error is detected. (e.g., 'cry_1.gif')

visualsgifs.tags.afk.description: Tags to search for when you go AFK.

visualsgifs.tags.test.description: Tags to search for with the 'Test GIF' command.

visualsgifs.tags.success.description: Tags to search for when code finishes successfully (Exit Code 0) or Debugging ends.

visualsgifs.error.debounceTime.description: Milliseconds to wait before showing an error GIF. Helps avoid showing GIFs while typing. (Default: 3000ms)

visualsgifs.events.enableError.description: Enable or disable GIFs when a syntax error is detected.

visualsgifs.events.enableAfk.description: Enable or disable GIFs when you are away from keyboard (AFK).

visualsgifs.events.enableSuccess.description: Enable or disable GIFs when code execution or tasks finish successfully.

scripts.compile: npm run check-types && npm run lint && node esbuild.js
scripts.package: npm run check-types && npm run lint && node esbuild.js --production
scripts.pretest: npm run compile-tests && npm run compile && npm run lint
